intro: Galium firmum f. balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of alpine and subalpine flora.
